instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had L9004 burned from bent pins being inserted into lcd connector. I have since replaced L9004 and have jumper running to pins 2 and 3 and <CAPACITOR>C9012</CAPACITOR> but everytime board powers up the jumper burns itself and then only get backlight with no question mark folder or apple logo.

What m I missing here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: using good known test lcd as well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Do you have a short on pin 2 of the inductor??? Sounds like there is a short in the LCD connector that keeps blowing the inductor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Check for short at pins 2/3 of J9000 w/ and w/o LCD connected.
If short only appears when insert de video cable, then bad cable, connector, or LCD assembly.
If not, just bad connector (lucky case).

Never power up the board before checking for short, like in this case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: I get a short on meter everytime I have L9004 connected to the pins on J9000. Cant be LCD connector, already replaced it. Once I disconnect L9004 short goes away. Do I need to solder L9004 somewhere else?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: It doesnt matter where I solder L9004. Tried TP <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW</SIGNAL> for one side and ran jumper from other side to pins 2 and 3 and as soon as jumper wire is ran short returns

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: could not using <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR> have anything to do with it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Did you change LCD connector?
Forget about <CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>, not really needed.

Scratch the board at pad 2/L9004, short could be there too.
I f is the case, cut off the trace between L9004 and J9000; then run a wire from pad 1/L9004.
